meanings.definition: moderate in size, amount, or rank
meanings.sent1: The house was of middling size, not too big or too small.
meanings.sent2: She gave a middling performance in the school play.
meanings.sent3: The middling cake was neither delicious nor terrible.
meanings.sent4: His skills were middling compared to the other players on the team.
meanings.sent5: The weather was middling, neither too hot nor too cold.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant served middling food that was neither exceptional nor terrible.
meanings.sent2: The movie received middling reviews from critics.
meanings.sent3: His painting was middling, not impressive but not awful either.
meanings.sent4: The hotel offered middling service, nothing outstanding but nothing terrible.
meanings.sent5: The student received a middling grade on the test, not great but not failing either.

meanings.sent1: He held a middling position in the company, not too high up but not at the bottom either.
meanings.sent2: The thermometer showed a middling temperature, not too hot or too cold.
meanings.sent3: The cake was baked to a perfect middling, not undercooked or overcooked.
meanings.sent4: She aimed for a middling level of effort, not too little but not too much.
meanings.sent5: The town was located at a middling distance from the city, not too close but not too far either.
